pr_title: Fix #75: Configuration mismatch between docs and code

timeline.message: Fix #75: Configuration mismatch between docs and code

timeline.bodyText: What happened to these configurations, why have we lost support for this?
timeline.author: manusa
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -237,31 +238,10 @@ A working example can be found in the  https://github.com/jkubeio/kubernetes-mav
       </all>
     </labels>
 
-    <deployment> <!--4-->
-      <name>${project.artifactId}</name>
-      <replicas>1</replicas>
-
-      <containers> <!--5-->
-        <container>
-          <alias>camel-app</alias> <!--6-->
-          <ports>
-            <port>8778</port>
-          </ports>
-          <mounts>
-            <scratch>/var/scratch</scratch>
-          </mounts>
-        </container>
-      </containers>
-
-      <volumes> <!--7-->
-        <volume>
-          <name>scratch</name>
-          <type>emptyDir</type>
-        </volume>
-      </volumes>
-    </deployment>
-
-    <services> <!--8-->
+    <replicas>2</replicas> <!--4-->
+    <controllerName>${project.artifactId}</controllerName> <!--5-->
+
+    <services> <!--6-->

replies.bodyText: I looked into old plugin versions but I couldn't find any config for containers or deployments.
replies.author: rohanKanojia

timeline.message: Fix #75: Configuration mismatch between docs and code

timeline.bodyText:
We're in OpenShift documentation, see line 5.
Same applies here, oc-m-p o-m-p or any other permutation should be replaced by omp (for consistency with the kmp chosen in Kubernetes Maven Plugin docs).
timeline.author: manusa
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -144,7 +144,7 @@ mvn oc:resource oc:deploy
 
 By default a _Service_ and a _Deployment_ object pointing to the created Docker image is created. When running in OpenShift mode, a _Service_ and _DeploymentConfig_ which refers the _ImageStream_ created with `oc:build` will be installed.
 
-Of course you can bind all those jkube.goals to execution phases as well, so that they are called along with standard lifecycle goals like `install`. For example, to bind the building of the Kubernetes resource files and the Docker images, add the following goals to the execution of the f-m-p:
+Of course you can bind all those jkube.goals to execution phases as well, so that they are called along with standard lifecycle goals like `install`. For example, to bind the building of the Kubernetes resource files and the Docker images, add the following goals to the execution of the kmp:
